page.title: 13Stainton Parish Church
page.content: Last year we went to look at{ {Stainton Parish Church.}We found that the church was very old. Some of the {stones}in the wall were of{carved {animals}made by the{Saxons.}Stainton means{stoney farm}in Saxon.The{Vicar} showed us some beautiful{silver}given to the parish by{Sir William Turner} who was the{Lord Mayor of London}years ago.{Captain Cook's parents}were{ {married}in this church. We looked around the church for some{wooden mice carved by the famous{Mouseman of {Kilburn.}We found six. Outside one of the boys lay down in a{stone trough.}Then the Vicar told us it was a{Saxon chief's coffin!}Saxon men must have been very small. Stainton was mentioned in the{ {Domeday Book}as{terra Roberti Mallet,} the land of Robert Mallet.
